source.name: Chicago Public Schools - Network Boundaries - High Schools - KML
source.description: District-run schools in CPS are organized into five geographic collaboratives – North/Northwest, West, Southwest, South, and Far South – and then further divided into 19 Networks, which provide administrative support, strategic direction and leadership development to the schools within each Network. There are 13 elementary Networks, four high school Networks, one K-12 Network that serves both elementary and high schools, and one alternative Network for alternative schools. chools in Chicago Public Schools district are organized into five geographic collaboratives – North/Northwest, West, Southwest, South, and Far South. These collaboratives are then further divided into 19 Networks, which provide administrative support, strategic direction and leadership development to the schools within each Network. There are 13 elementary Networks, four high school Networks, one K-12 Network that serves both elementary and high schools, and one alternative Network for alternative schools. To view or use these shapefiles, compression software, such as 7-Zip, and special GIS software, such as Goofle Earth, are required. To download this file, right-click the "Download" link above and choose "Save link as."
